buttonCollapseAccordion.description: Brief explanation for button to collapse the accordion

titleButtonCollapseAccordion.message: Collaps the accordion by closing all details
titleButtonCollapseAccordion.description: Verbose explanation for button to collapse the accordion

buttonExpandAccordion.description: Brief explanation for button to open the accordion

titleButtonExpandAccordion.message: Expand the accordion by opening all details
titleButtonExpandAccordion.description: Verbose explanation for button to open the accordion

checkboxTextarea.description: Brief explanation for input mode checkbox

titleCheckboxTextarea.message: The input of the expression occurs in a textarea of variable size. The enter key ⏎ opens a new line instead of initiating the calculation.
titleCheckboxTextarea.description: Verbose explanation for input mode checkbox in popup and on option page

inputSize.description: Brief explanation for size (80:5 default) in input field

titleInputSize.message: The size (“width:height”) of new input fields and the width for non-resizable fields. If “height” (or “:height”) is 0 or omitted, it defaults to 5; if “width” is 0 or omitted, it defaults to 80. The value can be changed by putting 'width:height' somewhere on the input line.
titleInputSize.description: Verbose explanation for size in popup and on option page

titleButtonAbbrSize.message: The text 'width' or 'width:height' (in these quotes) within an expression modifies this option.
titleButtonAbbrSize.description: Verbose explanation how to set size in an expression

inputBase.description: Brief explanation for output base (2-36) in input field

titleInputBase.message: The number base (2-36) which is used for the output of the resulting numbers. Any other value than 2-36 means that the usual basis 10 is used and that the additional output of the basis itself is omitted.
titleInputBase.description: Verbose explanation for output base (2-36) in popup and on option page

titleButtonAbbrBase.message: The text "base" (in these quotes) within an expression modifies this option.
titleButtonAbbrBase.description: Verbose explanation how to set base in an expression

titleCheckboxClipboard.message: Automatically copy the result to the clipboard for calculations or when restoring/adding a stored session
titleCheckboxClipboard.description: Verbose explanation for clipboard checkbox in popup and on option page

checkboxAccordion.description: Brief explanation for checkbox to store accordion state

titleCheckboxAccordion.message: Store for every item of the accordion whether it is opened, and propagate the state to other calc-extension tabs!
titleCheckboxAccordion.description: Verbose explanation for checkbox to store accordion state

checkboxStore.description: Brief explanation for checkbox to store options

titleCheckboxStore.message: Store options set in the main calc-extension tab on local storage (which survives a browser restart) and propagate them to all calc-extension tabs. This option has no influence on the preferences tab: Options set in the preferences are always stored and propagated. Note that “Options” refers not only to the options listed in “Options” but includes all other checkboxes as well.
titleCheckboxStore.description: Verbose explanation for checkbox to store options

titleButtonClearStorage.message: This clears all locally stored data of the extension and propagates this change to all calc-extension tabs. In particular, all options are reset to their default
titleButtonClearStorage.description: Verbose explanation to clear storage button

textLinkOpen.description: Link for opening a new session

textRightToLeft.description: Brief text for operators with right-to-left precedence

titleTextRightToLeft.message: Sequentiel Expressions with these operators are evaluated from right to left. For instance, a**b**c is a**b**c equivalent to a**(b**c) or a=b=c is equivalent to a=(b=c).
titleTextRightToLeft.description: Verbose text for operators with right-to-left precedence

titleButtonAbbrUarr.message: “a**b” is a raised to the power of b.

titleButtonAbbrTimes.message: “a*b” is the product of a and b.

titleButtonAbbrSlash.message: “a/b” is the quotient of a and b.

titleButtonAbbrPercentage.message: “a%b” is the remainder of the division of a by b.

titleButtonAbbrPlus.message: “a+b” is the sum of a and b.

titleButtonAbbrMinus.message: “a-b” is the difference of a and b.

titleButtonAbbrAmp.message: “a&b” is the binary AND of a and b.

titleButtonAbbrPow.message: “a&b” is the binary XOR of a and b.

titleButtonAbbrVert.message: “a|b” is the binary OR of a and b.

titleButtonAbbrAssign.message: “a=b” assigns to the variable a the value of b. The result of the assignment is the variable a.

titleButtonAbbrSin.message: “sin x” is the sine of x (x in radians).

titleButtonAbbrCos.message: “cos x” is the cosine of x (x in radians).

titleButtonAbbrTan.message: “tan x” is the tangent of x (x in radians).

titleButtonAbbrAsin.message: “asin x” is the arcsine of x in radians.

titleButtonAbbrAcos.message: “acos x” is the arccosine of x in radians.

titleButtonAbbrAtan.message: “tan x” is the arctangent of x in radians.

titleButtonAbbrSinh.message: “sinh x” is the hyperbolic sine of x.

titleButtonAbbrCosh.message: “cosh x” is the hyperbolic cosine of x.

titleButtonAbbrTanh.message: “tanh x” is the hyperbolic tangent of x.

titleButtonAbbrAsinh.message: “asinh x” is the hyperbolic areasine of x.

titleButtonAbbrAcosh.message: “acosh x” is the hyperbolic areacosine of x.

titleButtonAbbrAtanh.message: “tanh x” is the hyperbolic areatangent of x.

titleButtonAbbrLog10.message: “log10 x” is the base 10 logarithm of x.

titleButtonAbbrLog2.message: “log2 x” is the base 2 logarithm of x.

titleButtonAbbrLog.message: “log x” is the natural logarithm of x.

titleButtonAbbrLog1p.message: “log1p x” is the natural logarithm of 1+x.

titleButtonAbbrExp.message: “exp x” is the exponential function (base E).

titleButtonAbbrExpm1.message: “expm1 x” is the exponential function (base E) minus 1.

titleButtonAbbrRadic.message: “sqrt x” is the square root of x.

titleButtonAbbrCuberoot.message: “cbrt x” is the cube root of x.

titleButtonAbbrClz32.message: “clz32 x” is the number of leading zeroes in a 32 bit representation of x.

titleButtonAbbrAbs.message: “abs x” is the absolute value of x.

titleButtonAbbrSign.message: “sign x” is the signum of x (1, 0, or -1).

titleButtonAbbrFloor.message: “floor x” is x rounded down to an integer.

titleButtonAbbrCeil.message: “ceil x” is x rounded up to an integer.

titleButtonAbbrTrunc.message: “trunc x” is x rounded to the integer of smaller absolute value.

titleButtonAbbrRound.message: “round x” is x rounded to its nearest integer.

titleButtonAbbrFround.message: “fround x” is x rounded to its nearest 32 bit float.

titleButtonAbbrPi.message: Circle number: area of the unit disc

titleButtonAbbrEpsilon.message: Distance of 1 to the smallest larger floating point number

summaryNumbers.description: Announcement of numbers, some variables and others

titleButtonAbbrVarA.message: Insert variable name (with a trailing space).

titleButtonAbbr0x.message: Insert “0x”, which indicates the start of a hexadecimal number.

titleButtonAbbr0.message: Insert “0”, which either denotes the number symbol 0 or indicates the start of an octal number.

titleButtonAbbrNumericE.message: Insert the letter “e”, which is used in scientific number notation like 1.2e-2.

summaryLast.description: Announcement of symbol for last result and clipboard actions

titleButtonAbbrLast.message: The last result can be accessed within an expression with the “#” symbol

buttonClipboard.description: Button to copy last result to clipboard

titleButtonClipboard.message: The last result “#” is copied to the clipboard.
titleButtonClipboard.description: Explain that the last result is copied to clipboard

buttonAllClipboard.description: Button to copy the whole window to clipboard

titleButtonAllClipboard.message: All input fields and results are copied to the clipboard.
titleButtonAllClipboard.description: Explain that the whole window is copied to clipboard

textOptionOn.description: Briefly explain that option will be switched on

titleTextOptionOn.message: When using the symbol “!” within an expression, this option will be activated
titleTextOptionOn.description: Verbosely explain that option will be switched on

textOptionOff.description: Briefly explain that option will be switched off

titleTextOptionOff.message: When using the symbol “?” within an expression, this option will be deactivated
titleTextOptionOff.description: Verbosely explain that option will be switched off

titleButtonStoreSession.message: The session is stored on local storage, surviving a browser restart. The session consists of all input fields and results, all variables, and the last result “#”.
titleButtonStoreSession.description: Explain what storing a session means

titleButtonRestoreSession.message: The window content is replaced by the stored session. Also “#” gets the value of the stored session. Currently set variables are kept unless they had a different value in the stored session.
titleButtonRestoreSession.description: Explain what restoring a session means

buttonAddSession.description: Button to add the stored session

titleButtonAddSession.message: The input fields and results of the stored session are appended to the current session. Also “#” gets the value of the stored session. Currently set variables are kept unless they had a different value in the stored session.
titleButtonAddSession.description: Explain what adding a session means

buttonClearStored.description: Button to clear the stored session

titleButtonClearStored.message: The stored session is removed from local storage. This has no immediately visible effect.
titleButtonClearStored.description: Explain what clearing a stored session means

buttonCleanLine.description: Button to clean the current line

titleButtonCleanLine.message: All input text from the current line is removed.
titleButtonCleanLine.description: Explain that all input text from the current line will be removed

textRemoveLine.description: Brief explanation how to remove a line

titleTextRemoveLine.message: If an expression contains nothing but spaces and option modifiers, evaluating it will remove the line in which it is placed. You can use that feature to remove a line from a session by clearing the expression manually and re-evaluating it
titleTextRemoveLine.description: Verbose explanation how to remove a line

buttonRemoveLine.description: Button to remove the current line

titleButtonRemoveLine.message: The current line is completely removed.
titleButtonRemoveLine.description: Explain that the current line will be removed

buttonMoveLineUp.description: Button to move the current line up

titleButtonMoveLineUp.description: Explain that the current line will be moved up

buttonMoveLineDown.description: Button to move the current line down

titleButtonMoveLineDown.description: Explain that the current line will be moved down

buttonInsertLine.description: Button to insert a new empty line over the current line

titleButtonInsertLine.message: Insert a new empty line over the current line
titleButtonInsertLine.description: Explain that a new empty line will be inserted over the current line

titleButtonClearWindow.description: Explain that all lines will be removed from the window

buttonRedrawLine.description: Button to redraw the current line

titleButtonRedrawLine.message: Only after the line is redrawn the change of this option becomes visible.
titleButtonRedrawLine.description: Explain why to redraw a line

titleButtonRedrawWindow.message: Only after the window is redrawn the change of this option becomes visible in all lines.
titleButtonRedrawWindow.description: Explain why to redraw the window

titleInput.message: Enter the expression you want to evaluate, e.g. “1+2cos PI”. To actually start the evaluation press the enter key ⏎ or the “~>” button.

titleTextarea.message: Enter the expression you want to evaluate, e.g. “1+2cos PI”. To actually start the evaluation press the “~>” button.

textResult.description: Substituting text for the result button when copying to Clipboard. For clarity, this should not be empty and contain a symbol combination not usable in an expression

titleTextResult.message: The result of the expression after pressing the enter key ⏎. There is also an option to replace this text by a button and the let the enter key start a new line.

messageResult.description: output specified result in specified base

errorBadSingleQuote.message: syntax error in 'input area size' specification

errorNoLast.message: cannot use “#” (yet): there was no last result
errorNoLast.description: error for using non-existent last result #

errorUnresolvableFunction.message: function “$NAME$” cannot be resolved. Possibly missing braces
errorUnresolvableFunction.description: error for specified unresolvable function, probably due to missing braces

errorAssignNonVariable.message: attempt to assign a value to a non-variable
errorAssignNonVariable.description: error for an attempt to assign to a non-variable

errorParse.description: error for an unspecified parse error

errorNaN.message: a mathematical operation received invalid arguments
errorNaN.description: error if result of expression is NaN

textImplicit.description: Name of token for an implicit multiplikation
